I think you might need to add `pytest-runner` to the `host` section since it is in `setup_requires` in the `setup.py`:

https://github.com/DRI-WSWUP/RefET/blob/master/setup.py#L44
Thanks!  I added pytest-runner to the host section and the tests seem to be passing (travis and circle so far).
Consider adding the `license_file` to the source distribution in future releases instead of having to manually package it with the recipe.

Sorry!  I was trying to follow the structure of some other feedstocks and noticed the license file in the recipe.  Since I already have a license file in the source distribution, do I just need to remove the file from the recipe?

If you look in the tarball on pypi, the license file actually isn't included in the source distribution. I believe the proper way to handle this is to add a `MANIFEST.in` to the repo that includes the license file:

https://docs.python.org/2/distutils/sourcedist.html#specifying-the-files-to-distribute

It's fine for now. I'll merge and you can change it in the feedstock in a future release if you add it.
